p: To determine virus titers in the infected mice, groups of five mice were inoculated intranasally with 10 4 FFU of each virus. Lungs and nasal turbinates were collected 3 d post-infection (dpi) and virus titers in the organs were measured by focus-forming assays. Virus titers in the infected mice were in agreement with their polymerase activity and replication kinetics in human cells in vitro. Current genotype EG/2013-wt and G1(3P+NP) E627V/E543D/A655V/K526R viruses replicated most efficiently in the lungs and nasal turbinates ( Fig 6C), with titers comparable to each other. In contrast, ancestral genotype viruses G1(3P+NP)-wt and EG/2013 V627E/D543E/V655A/R526K replicated with appreciably lower titers in the lungs, and showed clearly attenuated replication in the nasal turbinates: viruses were detected in only one of the five nasal turbinates of the infected mice. EG/2013 V627E and G1(3P+NP) E627V viruses showed intermediate replication in the mice.
